meanings.definition: To eat or drink quickly and greedily.
meanings.sent1: The hungry dog snarfed down its food in seconds.
meanings.sent2: She snarfed her favorite candy bar in one bite.
meanings.sent3: The raccoon snarfed the picnic basket when no one was looking.
meanings.sent4: He snarfed the popcorn like a vacuum cleaner.
meanings.sent5: The child snarfed the ice cream, leaving no trace behind.

meanings.definition: To inhale or consume quickly and eagerly.
meanings.sent1: The student snarfed the information from the textbook before the exam.
meanings.sent2: She snarfed the fresh air as she ran through the park.
meanings.sent3: The vacuum cleaner snarfed up all the dust bunnies in the room.
meanings.sent4: He snarfed the aroma of freshly baked cookies from the kitchen.
meanings.sent5: The baby snarfed the scent of flowers in the garden.

meanings.definition: To steal or take something quickly and slyly.
meanings.sent1: The mischievous cat snarfed the fish from the kitchen counter.
meanings.sent2: She snarfed a cookie from the jar when no one was looking.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel snarfed the nuts from the bird feeder without getting caught.
meanings.sent4: He snarfed the pen from his friend's desk during class.
meanings.sent5: The magpie snarfed the shiny trinket and flew away swiftly.
